in my experience weapon changes by some order, which has two ways:
1 weapons change by round
1 2 3 4
if you use 3 - next will be 4, then 1, 2, then 3 for reload;
2 weapons change for the first
1 2 3 4
if you use 3 - next will be 1, then 2, then 3 with reload

Your shotgun - 1, your gatling - 2, your lizaro - 3, so, Gatling never will be next (except case shotgun broken)

On november 1, 2012
Kompera

My only disagreements would be Scavenger and the Fragmentation Grenade.

Scavenger is like being a Saboteur, but with zero chance for Smart or Suspicious to negate. And I think we're all well aware of how the field has become flooded with Smart Troopers, and how effective Saboteurs are. Yes, Scavenger only takes one weapon, but it takes the weapon in hand, and that forces a rearming action that Saboteur does not unless it gets lucky and takes the weapon in hand. And Scavenger has a range of over half the battlefield, making it able to take just about any weapon without needing to move into range. Only rifles and launchers make this necessary.

The Fragmentation Grenade would be my other objection. I love it dearly. It has the innate ability of being immune to Interception, and it is seriously boosted by skills such as Heartbreaker and Hydroshock Shells (and the much more rare Anatomy), which are for many players a no-brainer choice of skill. It also has a larger AOE than the Grenade, and is more accurate as well. It's a rare chance that it misses completely, and a head shot can kill a 10 health Trooper immediately and without needing any other boosting skills.

The game does that. It awards points for the every Phase you do. Even though you were in your 15th Phase, you completed 14 Phases since we all start on Raid 1.

An example of that is if I want 40 credits from raids, I'll have to complete 10 Phases. Since we start on Raid Phase 1, I'll have to reach Raid Phase 11 to get 40 credits.

On april 3, 2013
Kompera

I don't think that's the best strategy. He is a solo trooper army, so it's clear that lower numbers of troopers is a winning strategy, when you're fast.

Six L6 Troopers is going to be more than 25 points. Five L1 Troopers and one high level trooper is just going to feed his Frenetic and you'll never get a turn. And Invincible is a L5+ skill.


A two or three man army is, IMO, the best way to go. As many Troopers as you can squeeze under 25 points with and still have them all be at least L5, and L6 would be better for the chance to get Spy for more initiative. That's probably 2 or 3. But not a 'human wave' style army with a bunch of Frenetic bait L1 troopers and only 1 higher level trooper. You want to try to get two/three fast troopers who can live through FirstTry's initial initiative advantage. So, On Point for sure, plus Twinoid, Coffee, and as many health boosts as you can get.

The only other real option is to try to catch him with your own solo army. Which you can do up to a point, since he's got to make 1000+ credits to level, and that'll take a new solo trooper a long way. But there, you'll still be slower unless you get better speed boosts than he has. Coffee, Enthusiastic, Amphetamine Shot, Wife Beater, etc.

Wait for Smart troopers. Don't give them helmets one at a time. Wait until they are all at level 5. That way you have better options to tweak your army.

Avoid Twinoid and On Point (this one for spies only).

Take Hydroshock Shells and blue (LP) skills (no Bait though).

Compensator for snipers and as much Cold Blooded and Nimble Fingers as you can.

On june 23, 2013
Kompera

Another thing I occasionally do is to level a trooper to L6 and not choose either option if I want both but also have other troopers to level up. There's nothing forcing you to make the call now. The only penalty is that you can't go past L6 until you pick one of the choices offered to you.

But if for example I get Munitions + Communications and I only want 1 in the army, I'll just be patient and delay choosing. The choices never change so it's just a matter of patience and hoping that your other troopers make the choice clear once they get their L6 helmet.
